div.strong: Needs to update for new Apple Watch OS

div.div: I like the app but I have an Apple Watch and the app does not record heart rate. My understanding is that with the new Apple Watch OS 2 they should be able to do that. I'm patiently waiting for that feature. Once they implement that I will come back and give 5 stars.

I use this application to map trail runs on a PC and then track them on my phone. Compared to Run Keeper, Map My Run is very inaccurate when creating a route and and then tracking the run. When using it, the free version is so spammy it is in operable. Audio ads come up when listening to music. It makes you want to throw your phone in the woods. And good luck trying to operate the app on your phone when your run. It is impossible not to click on links taking you to other websites which is a real pain.
What happened to the sound after you updated? It wont tell me when I've started, how far I've gone or anything! I liked it better before the update!

div.strong: Gets the job done but has issues

div.div: My biggest issue with this app is that the different areas don't see to connect to each other very well at all. If I delete a workout, it's still on my activity feed and in the route list. Today I was trying to organize all my routes and workouts and it was infuriating. What I would like to do is use a workout to create a route and then apply that route to other runs that went the same way so I could compare my all my runs on that route; but I cannot do that. You guys seem to think what I care about is comparing myself against other people, but really all I care about is comparing myself against my past self. Furthermore, the notes on workouts are only visible in the activity feed and are unable to be edited once posted. The app just isn't very intuitive beyond the basics of recording a workout. I would try out other running apps if I could but this app has all my data and it carry out the essentials (mapping your run) pretty well. So please, just make it easier to organize past routes and workouts.
For some reason, the app does not accurately track the route I traveled or the time. I have no idea why, but this is incredibly frustrating.

Recent attempts to monetize (ads, "upgrade" splash screen, etc) have caused major performance and stability issues. Often takes me 3+ minutes to start tracking my run, and sometimes a full restart. It's been closer to 10 second in the past.
I'm now using Runtastic.
Hope the same thing doesn't happen to MapMyRide.
I used to love this app, but now there are just too many little windows and ads when you first start it up... I just wanna run...

div.strong: Challenges and support are a joke

div.div: Does well with recording and logging workouts but what has really turned me off are the challenges and help desk support. I had about 10 miles not showing up on two challenges, and confirmed all were qualified. I submitted a ticket with all screen prints and calculations, and got a response a week later to check and make sure they were qualified. Did the exact same thing again and then didn't get a response for week. They told me basically they were looking into it and to hang tight. Ticket changes to solved so I responded and reopened it. Ticket changed to waiting for my reply three times and then after about a month, they just deleted it all together. Ridiculous.

The delta time is too long. The trace around a track should be on top of each other for each loop, but the distance from the innermost traced loop and the outermost can be as much as 20' as opposed the max 2'. Also when racing the distance measured is too long, that is the 6 mile notice is 1/2 mile before the marker.
Th PAUSE button should be activated by a two finger swipe; often it is the inadvertently activated and it wastes my workout.

The delta time is too long. The trace around a track should be on top of each other for each loop, but the distance from the innermost traced loop and the outermost can be as much as 20' as opposed the max 2'. Also when racing the distance measured is too long.
Th PAUSE button should be activated by a two finger swipe; often it is the inadvertently activated and it wastes my workout.

I walk around a track so I know 4 times around I hit 1 mile. This app would tell me I walked a mile after 3.25 laps. It also says I burned 400 calories after a walk which a friend told me there is no way that is right. I can't use it if it is not accurate.

I've used this app multiple times daily through more than one iPhone version and with high and low memory and though it was leggy at times it seemed to work great. But, at some point this year it became so buggy it seemed to affect everything I tried to do with my iPhone and apps. I had to restore my iPhone 6 plus to factory settings. When I reloaded this app, the bugginess reappeared. Restored without this app and it seemed to fix the problems. Based on other reports here I'm pretty sure it was this app. Someone reported it has been fixed but I'm not sure I want to go through all that again just to try using this app again, as good as it was. It's too bad. Hate to lose the history. Trying a couple of alternative apps but would prefer this one minus the issues.
About ten percent of the time the app erases my workout. Since I don't have a gps watch, this is my only tacking mechanism and losing data is very frustrating.
After the recent update, I used this app and it calculates my miles wrong. Needless to say the update didn't work....

div.strong: updated, now they want personal info

div.div: used the free app for a while, applied update today, now it wants me to "join" with a name, email, and birth date. apparently zero functionality unless you do this, guess not enough people buying the paid version, not happy about this...
So is Okkay

The app is clearly struggling under its own weight. Nearly every time I try to open it, there will be a freeze or crash. While the goal of providing a unified system for tracking workouts, nutrition and social fitness app is great, the functions is hampered by its slowness and the fact that it is crash-prone. Even the gps, the core functionality of the app, has taken a hit because of this. Either fix the issues or break out the different systems into different apps.
Started out fine. Now it freezes and crashes on a regular basis. Even if it opens, any app opened after it will freeze and crash.

Takes forever to load, doesn't keep me logged in, and I hate that the "slide to finish" and resume buttons are next to each other - I constantly accidentally end my workout when I mean to resume.
Also, 75% of the time it "can't load" my workout history....even on wifi.
It does seem to be accurate and I like that I can pause a workout.

div.strong: Used to love before UA took over

div.div: Don't get me wrong, I like under armour but since their take over, it constantly freezes or won't open at all. If I get a call while working out, the GPS totally screws up and messes up my time and distance. This app needs a serious upgrade! Come on UA! You are better than this!!
I would give this 5 stars again if it would allow me to select location tracking only when using. I don't like apps to track my location when I'm not even using it. It's creepy so get rid of it!

Routes don't sync so you can't find them on your phone. Support tells you to re-install. After every time you create a route?? No thanks. When you select a route and click "do it" the app creates a new route anyway.
Need pace per mile breakdown! If thr app already tells you per mile pace as you run, why not to just add it on the screen? Please add it and it will be a 5 star app.
Phew good app does not perform 60% of time

When this app is working it's great. It drops my workouts and challenges at least twice a month. Ive gone from being in the top ten percent to the bottom 90 in the last three challenges I signed up for. I've tried to get help but it's impossible to send a message directly. I will not pay for a membership when there are so many bugs.
